stretches.instructions: Sit in a comfortable position. Close your eyes and take slow, deep breaths. Focus on the sensation of the air entering and leaving your body. If your mind wanders, gently bring your attention back to your breath.

Lie down or sit comfortably. Close your eyes and slowly move your attention through your body, starting from your toes and working up to your head. Notice any sensations, tension, or relaxation without judgment.
Sit or lie down comfortably. Close your eyes and imagine a peaceful place. Picture yourself there and focus on the sights, sounds, and smells.
Sit upright. Slowly tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear toward your shoulder. Hold for a few seconds and repeat on the other side.
Sit upright and gently pull your head to the side with one hand while keeping the opposite shoulder relaxed.
Lower your chin to your chest while keeping your shoulders relaxed. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
Gently turn your head to one side as far as is comfortable, hold, then turn to the other side.
Place your hand behind your head, pull down toward your armpit, and gently stretch the neck.
Stand in a doorway with your arms on the door frame at shoulder height. Step forward to stretch the chest.
Clasp your hands behind your back, straighten your arms, and lift your chest up toward the sky.
Place your arm at a 90-degree angle against a wall and step forward to open up the chest.
Lie on your back with your arms extended out to the sides, gently pressing them toward the ground.
Pull one arm across your chest with the opposite hand, keeping your shoulder down.
Stand tall and rotate your shoulders in large circles, first forward, then backward.
Extend both arms in front, cross one arm over the other, bend the elbows, and press the backs of your hands together to stretch the shoulders.
Stand in a doorway, raise one arm to 90 degrees, and step forward to stretch the shoulder.
Place your hand against a wall at shoulder height with fingers pointing back, and gently turn your body away.
Sit on the floor with your hands behind you and fingers pointing away from your body. Lean slightly backward to stretch the biceps.
Extend your arm forward, palm up, and use your other hand to gently pull back on your fingers.
Reach both arms overhead and interlock your fingers. Gently pull up and back to stretch the biceps.
Raise one arm overhead and bend the elbow, using your other hand to gently push the elbow down.
Hold one arm across your body and use the opposite hand to gently press the elbow, stretching the triceps.
Sit on the floor, place your hands behind you with fingers pointing toward your body, and lift your hips to stretch the triceps.
Place one hand behind your head and press your arm against a wall to deepen the stretch.
Extend your arm in front of you, palm facing down, and use your opposite hand to gently pull back on your fingers.
Extend your arm in front of you, palm facing up, and gently pull back on your fingers to stretch the forearm.
Grab the forearm of one hand with the opposite hand and gently squeeze while rotating the wrist in small circles.
Press your palms together in front of your chest and slowly lower them to stretch your forearms.
Spread your fingers wide and hold for a few seconds, then relax and repeat.
Make a fist and hold for 5 seconds, then release and stretch your fingers wide.
Press the palms of your hands together and push, then stretch your fingers up and apart.
Use your other hand to gently pull the thumb backward, stretching the base of the thumb.
Lie face down and push up with your hands, keeping your hips on the ground to stretch the abdomen.
Start on your hands and knees, alternating between arching your back up (cat) and lowering your belly (cow).
Sit with legs straight in front of you, reaching for your toes to stretch the lower abdominals.
Hold a plank position, engaging your core muscles for stability while keeping your body in a straight line.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and reach one arm overhead while bending to the opposite side.
Lie on your back, bring one knee across your body to the opposite side, and gently twist to stretch the obliques.
Hold a side plank position, engaging the obliques for stability.
Stand and clasp your hands overhead, then gently lean to one side to stretch the obliques.
Stand on one leg and pull your opposite foot toward your glutes, keeping your knees close together.
Lie on your side, grab your top ankle, and pull it toward your glutes to stretch the quad.
Kneel on the floor, and spread your knees wide while keeping your feet together, sitting back to stretch your quads.
Step one foot forward into a lunge and drop your back knee to the floor, stretching the quad of your back leg.
Sit with your feet together and gently press your knees toward the floor using your elbows.
Stand with legs wide apart and slowly bend forward to stretch the inner thighs.
Kneel and spread your knees wide, lowering your hips back to stretch the inner thighs.
Step to the side and bend one knee while keeping the other leg straight to stretch the inner thigh of the extended leg.
Kneel on the floor with your toes pointed back, then sit gently on your heels to stretch the shins.
Sit with your legs extended and point your toes, stretching the muscles along the front of your shin.
Stand and flex your foot back, pressing your toes to the ground, to stretch your shin muscles.
Sit on the floor, point your toes down, and gently press the tops of your feet into the ground.
Stand facing a wall, place one foot behind you, and press the heel into the ground while bending your front knee.
From a plank position, lift your hips up, pressing your heels toward the floor to stretch the calves.
Sit on the floor with your legs straight and pull your toes back toward your body to stretch the calves.
Sit with your legs straight, place a foam roller under your calves, and gently roll to stretch and massage the muscles.
Sit with one leg crossed over the other, grab your toes, and gently pull them back toward your shin.
Stand and roll the sole of your foot over a small ball or water bottle to stretch the arch of your foot.
Sit with your legs extended and flex your feet, pulling your toes back toward your body.
Curl your toes under and press them into the ground while sitting to stretch the foot muscles.
